medical_history.chief_complaint: Painful muscle spasms, weakness, and hyperreflexia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 4 months before admission with stiffness and cramping in both legs, associated with back pain. A rheumatologist diagnosed fibromyalgia and prescribed gabapentin, which did not improve symptoms. Two weeks prior to admission, muscle cramps worsened, with more severe cramps proximally, occurring after movement or pressure and waking the patient from sleep. Multiple falls occurred, necessitating the use of a walker. Pain rated at 10 on a scale of 0 to 10.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Hypertension, hypercholesterolemia, chronic low back pain radiating down the right leg to the midcalf.
medical_history.family_history: Parents had dementia, colon cancer, and died in their 90s; father had melanoma; maternal grandmother had breast cancer in her 70s; maternal cousin had breast cancer in her 30s.
medical_history.social_history: Widowed, recently retired from a professional position, drinks alcohol in moderation, does not smoke or use illicit drugs.
